items.title: Ex-Test cricketer Damien Martyn returns home after waking from induced coma

items.title: Independent film collective Movie Juice launches inaugural summer film fest
items.summary: Summer has hit its stride with a heatwave across the country this week, providing the perfect backdrop to a new film festival that features beaches, surfing, young love, and that horrible feeling of holidays ebbing by.

items.summary: Australia chases down 160 with five wickets remaining in Sydney to round out the Ashes in style as Usman Khawaja bids farewell to Test cricket.

items.summary: Ollie Peake survives a contentious overturned catch to smash a six on the final delivery to seal a four-wicket win for the Melbourne Renegades in Perth.

items.summary: Indigenous artist Bobbi Lockyer has been left frustrated after she sent a $4,000 custom artwork of the Pilbara to a buyer in Queensland, only for an empty cardboard sleeve to be delivered.

items.title: Inflation cools in November with consumer prices rising 3.4pc but still above the RBA's target

items.summary: Bayer's Monsanto has sued Pfizer, BioNTech and Moderna for allegedly misusing its messenger RNA technology in COVID vaccines.

items.title: Mystery over safe with beef jerky inside recovered from Shark Bay's ocean floor

items.summary: At a key meeting in Paris, officials from Europe, Canada, the US and NATO say they will provide Kyiv's frontline forces with equipment and training, and back them up with air, land and sea support to deter any future Russian attack.

items.title: Kids at tiny school work to save extremely rare 'flying jewel' purple copper butterfly
items.summary: It's the size of a 10-cent piece and matures under the guard of protective ants, but the purple copper butterfly needs more help to survive — and a group of NSW primary school students has stepped up to the challenge.

items.title: Outback NT hotel at centre of Peter Falconio mystery barred from serving alcohol
items.summary: The Barrow Creek Hotel was thrust into the global spotlight during the investigation into British backpacker Peter Falconio's disappearance. Now its liquor licence has been suspended for breaching Northern Territory licensing laws.

items.title: Ajla Tomljanović departs Brisbane International as Rinky Hijikata advances
items.summary: Australia's Ajla Tomljanović loses a tense three-set match to world number 20 Karolína Muchová, while Rinky Hijikata is the last remaining local hope in the men's draw.

items.title: Insurer Prosura hit by cyber data breach, customers contacted by 'threat actor'
items.summary: Australians who have rented cars have been caught up in a cyber incident affecting excess insurer Prosura, with customers receiving modified invoices from a self-proclaimed "threat actor".
